>  
> IIRC, Hideyoshi's motives are not known for sure. Hideyoshi did a nu=
mber
> of horrific and irrational things during the last decade of his life=
,
> and this appears to fall in to that category. I imagine it would have
>=
 been over something quite small or petty, and I've read that he did
> inde=
ed regret it afterwards.

I think you're right. There =
are theories, some good ones (although I
can't remember any off the top of =
my head - maybe Mary Berry's
"Hideyoshi" has some of the theories) but I th=
ink it is pretty
unanimous that it is uncertain why he did it.
